meanings.definition: To stop tracking or monitoring something.
meanings.sent1: I will untrack the package once it is delivered.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to untrack your location on the app for privacy.
meanings.sent3: After the detective untrack the suspect, he disappeared without a trace.
meanings.sent4: She decided to untrack her online activity to maintain anonymity.
meanings.sent5: The hunter had to untrack the elusive animal through the dense forest.

meanings.definition: Not able to be tracked or traced.
meanings.sent1: The ghost was untrack, leaving no footprints behind.
meanings.sent2: The encrypted message was untrack by anyone without the code.
meanings.sent3: The ninja moved in complete silence, untrack by his enemies.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were untrack, like a shadow in the night.
meanings.sent5: The spy's identity remained untrack, shrouded in mystery.

meanings.sent1: I tend to untrack time when I'm engrossed in a good book.
meanings.sent2: Don't untrack your keys or you'll have trouble finding them later.
meanings.sent3: She untrack her train of thought and forgot what she was saying.
meanings.sent4: The busy schedule made it easy to untrack important appointments.
meanings.sent5: In the chaos, it's easy to untrack where you left your belongings.
